docs.title: MkDocs for a Debian on VirtualBox/UTM
docs.text:
This GitHub Page is hosted at GitHub.com. For full documentation visit mkdocs.org. And remember, YOU ARE NOT VRTASS!

--- The Virtual Ass

docs.title: VirtualBox
docs.text: MkDocs is using local port 8000. On your VirtualBox, you must redirect/translate the local port 8000 to the host port 4999 because I already use 5000 for Jekyll and 5001 for Docusaurus.

docs.title: VirtualBox Settings
docs.text:
• Network:Adapter1:
    • Enable Network Adapter
    • Attached to: NAT
    • Port Forwarding:
      • 127.0.0.1:4999 (Host) --- 10.0.2.15:8000 (Guest)

docs.title: UTM
docs.text: MkDocs is using local port 8000. On your UTM, you must redirect/translate the local port 8000 to the host port 4999 because I already use 5000 for Jekyll and 5001 for Docusaurus.

docs.title: UTM Settings
docs.text:
• Network Mode: Emulated VLAN
    • Port Forward: New
      • Protocol: TCP
      • Guest Address: 10.0.2.15
      • Guest Port: 8000
      • Host Address: 127.0.0.1
      • Host Port: 4999
    • SAVE

docs.title: GitHub Repo Setting
docs.text: I prefer to start from GitHub so the results can be cloned.

docs.title: New GitHub Repo (GitHub Site)
docs.text:
Create a new repo according to your respective faith and beliefs. I am using user "vrtass" and creating a new repo "tester" in this example.

  • Create a new GitHub repo.
    • New Repository
    • Repository Name: "tester"
    • Description: "tester"
    • Public
    • Add README.md
    • Add .gitignore: Python (temporary)
    • Choose any free LICENSE
    • See also https://doit.vlsm.org/030.html
  • Create a GitHub page.
    • There is no need to do anything since the branch "gh-pages" will automatically create a GitHub Page?!

docs.title: Clone Repo on Your Debian
docs.text:
I am using user "vrtass" and creating a new repo "tester" in this example. Remember, YOU ARE NOT VRTASS!

# You are not "vrtass:, replace GITHUB variable  with your own repo!
GITHUB="vrtass"

# You might want to replace "tester" with any other repo name.
REPO="tester"


# Make sure, you have the proper GITHUB and REPO variable!
git clone git@github.com:$GITHUB/$REPO.git
cd $REPO/

docs.title: Deb Packages
docs.text:
Make sure the following Debian packages are present in your system.

# USER privilege.
export DEBS="
aptitude
build-essential
git
libffi-dev
libssl-dev
python3
python3-dev
python3-pip
python3-venv
sudo
tree
vim
wget
"
time sudo apt-get install $DEBS -y
date

docs.title: Check Python, Pip, and Venv
docs.text:
What is the current version?

python --version
pip --version
python -m venv --help

docs.title: Python Virtual Environment
docs.text:
A Python virtual environment is used for dependency isolation, avoidance of global installation, management of different Python versions, simplified dependency management, cleaner development environment, version control compatibility, and security.

# A centralized ".virtualenvs/" directory
mkdir -pv ~/.virtualenvs/

# Create a Virtual Environment
python3 -m venv ~/.virtualenvs/

docs.title: Activate the Virtual Environment
docs.text:
• Before working with "MkDocs", always activate the virtual environment!
# Always activate the VENV
source ~/.virtualenvs/bin/activate
tree

Once activated, you should see the name of the virtual environment in your terminal prompt, e.g. "(.virtualenvs) cbkadal@cbkadal:~/git/tester$ "

docs.title: Install MkDocs and additional MkDocs plugins
docs.text:
• Do not forget to activate the virtual environment!
# Upgrade, Clean Up, and Verify Version
pip install --upgrade          \
pip                            \
mkdocs                         \
mkdocs-awesome-pages-plugin    \
mkdocs-include-markdown-plugin \
mkdocs-macros-plugin           \
mkdocs-material                \
pymdown-extensions             \

echo "= ======================================="
pip --version
mkdocs --version
pip cache purge

docs.title: Create MkDocs inside repo "tester/"
docs.text:
• Check the file tree
# You must be inside the git repo "tester/".
mkdocs new .
tree

docs.title: Test from VirtualBox
docs.text:
# Check HOST at "localhost:4999" (HOST)
mkdocs serve --dev-addr=0.0.0.0:8000

docs.title: File: mkdocs.yml
docs.text:
Replace file "mkdocs.yml" by copy/paste the following. You might want to replace variables like "copyright", "site_url", "logo", "favicon.ico", etc. because YOU ARE NOT VRTASS!

copyright: Copyright © 2024-2024 VRTASS
site_name: MkDocs for Debian on VirtualBox/UTM
site_author: The Virtual Ass

site_description: >
           MkDocs for 
           a Virtual Debian Guest 
           on VirtualBox.
site_url:  https://vrtass.github.io/tester/

nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Examples: examples.md
  - GitHub: https://github.com/vrtass/tester/
  - WEB: https://vrtass.github.io/tester/

theme:
  name:    material
  font:
    text:  Verdana
    code:  Red Hat Mono
  logo:    img/vrtass.jpg
  favicon: img/favicon.ico
  features:
    - content.code.copy
    - navigation.footer
  palette:
    # Dark Mode
    - scheme: slate
      toggle:
        icon: material/weather-sunny
        name: Dark mode
      primary: green
      accent: deep purple

    # Light Mode
    - scheme: default
      toggle:
        icon: material/weather-night
        name: Light mode
      primary: blue
      accent: deep orange

markdown_extensions:
  - admonition
  - attr_list
  - pymdownx.details
  - pymdownx.emoji:
      emoji_index: !!python/name:material.extensions.emoji.twemoji
      emoji_generator: !!python/name:material.extensions.emoji.to_svg
  - pymdownx.highlight:
      anchor_linenums: true
      # linenums: true
      line_spans: __span
      pygments_lang_class: true
  - pymdownx.inlinehilite
  - pymdownx.snippets
  - pymdownx.superfences:
      custom_fences:
        - name: mermaid
          class: mermaid
          format: !!python/name:pymdownx.superfences.fence_code_format
  - pymdownx.tabbed:
      alternate_style: true

extra:
  author:          "The Virtual Ass"
  custom_variable: "This is a custom variable from mkdocs.yml"
  github_url:      "https://github.com/vrtass/tester/"
  social:
    - icon: simple/github
      link: https://github.com/vrtass/tester/

  seo:
    description: >
            MkDocs for 
            a Virtual Debian Guest 
            on VirtualBox.
    keywords: "keyword1, keyword2"

extra_css:
  - assets/styles.css

plugins:
  - awesome-pages
  - include-markdown
  - search
  - macros
